properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Mondays from 10:30am to 11:15am a session entitled Mindful Stretch, for which participants are required to pay £3 each session. On Mondays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On Tuesdays from 10am to 10:30am Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On Tuesdays from 4:30pm to 5pm Real Play for children aged between 5 and 7 years. On Thursdays from 10am to 10:30am Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On the first Thursday of each month a Reading Group for adults takes place starting at 2pm. On Fridays from 10:30am to 11:15am a session entitled Mindful Yoga, for which participants are required to pay £3 each session. On Fridays from 1pm to 2pm Creative Arts, this is for adults only and participants are required to book in advance. On Saturdays (in term time only) from 11am to 12 noon Code Club for children aged between 8 and 12 years. On Sundays from 11:30am to 12 noon Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Luton Central Library

properties.description: We run coffee mornings on Monday mornings (except Bank Holidays) from 9:30am to 12 noon. We offer free drinks, snacks, biscuits, cakes, fruit etc. for consumption on the premises and an opportunity to chat, play some games and keep warm & dry in bad weather. We operate essentially like a free Café. In addition, we have a small foodbank and a small clothing bank. These are from donations from our members or from the wider church, local supermarket collections and the items available may vary from week to week. There is no charge, it is open to all.
properties.title: High Town Baptist Church

properties.description:
Welcome Space Warm food and activities. The venue offers a warm welcome and a place to relax and meet others. This service is open to all but it runs in term time only. While there is a charge for some of the Thursday food service provisions listed below, nobody will go home unfed. The food related provision is as follows: 2nd Thursday of the month - Bacon Butty Morning from 10am to 12 noon for which there is a charge of £2.50 per session. 3rd Thursday of the month - Hart Lane Community Lunch, beginning at 12 noon for which there is a charge of £2.50 per session. 4th Thursday of the month - Community Refreshment Stop from 10am to 12 noon and donations are welcomed. Each of these provides opportunities to gather and for friendships to be renewed, made or continued. St Anne's also runs 2 Craft Groups although there is no food at these other than tea and biscuits. They run:
1 - A weekly Craft Group on Tuesdays from 10am - 12 noon in term time only, and 2 - A weekly Scrapbooking and Crafts on Saturdays from 10am until mid afternoon, but please note that this group does not run during the month of August.
properties.title: St Anne's Church

properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Tuesdays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On Wednesdays from 2pm to 2:30pm Rhyme Time for pre school age children. On the 3rd Wednesday of each month, starting at 2pm, Reading Group for Adults. On Thursdays from 2pm to 2:30pm Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Stopsley Library

properties.description: We provide weekly free snacks, soups, rolls and refreshments. Our service is open to everyone and anyone in our local wards which are Wigmore, Stopsley, Vauxhall, Round Green and Crawley. The Community Cafe is a drop in, there is no need to book in advance. We also offer jacket potatoes plus fillings on the first Wednesday of each month, for which we ask for a contribution of £1.
properties.title: Raynham Way Community Centre

properties.description: Luton Libraries are open to the public to join and make use of our building resources. This includes books, PC’s, photocopying and more. We also host regular activities across all our branches for all ages and abilities to join in with. Specific activities taking place in the library, together with any charges as necessary, are listed below. On Mondays from 2pm to 3pm Knit and Natter for adults. On Mondays from 4pm to 5pm Fun Time for Families. On Tuesdays from 10am to 11:30am Happy Babies for children aged between 3 and 12 months. On Tuesdays from 1pm to 2pm Creative Crafts for adults for which participants are required to book. On Wednesdays from 4pm to 4:30pm Real Play for children aged between 5 and 7 years. On Wednesdays, in term time only, are 2 sessions of Rhyme Time for pre school age children. Session 1 is from 9:30am to 10am, and session 2 is from 10:30am to 11am. On Thursdays from 4pm to 4:45pm Library Games for children aged 8 years and above. On the last Thursday of the month, starting at 11am Reading Group for Adults. On Fridays from 10am to 10:30am Story Time for children aged between 2 and 5 years. Please note that warm drinks/refreshments are not provided by libraries. Members of the public are welcome to bring in their own tea/coffee flasks etc. from elsewhere though. Libraries are open to all during opening hours. Certain activities are age restricted, please speak to a team member for more information. Full details can be found on our website: https://www.lutonlibraries.co.uk/home
properties.title: Leagrave Library

properties.description: During the autumn and winter months, on Thursday mornings between 10am and 12 noon the venue is a warm space. There is a Coffee Morning at which warm drinks and cakes are available to the public free of charge.
